intro: Ouratea ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous ouratea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many Rubiaceae species. The tree is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
